short_summary: Office relocation, furniture installation, tenant accomodation support and warehouse storage services
description: This contract is for the provision of relocation services of office equipment and furniture, furniture installation, tenant accommodation, and possible warehouse storage services for the Department of Fisheries and Oceans and the Canadian Coast Guard. The contract requires the contractor to provide services on an as-and-when basis to DFO/CCG employees in multiple locations. Services include whiteboard installation, picture frames, rotable office furniture installation, panel system installation, package delivery, and night moves. Additionally, the contractor may be required to store office furniture in a secure location for the duration of the contract.
full_summary:
# Office Relocation, Furniture Installation, Tenant Accommodation Support and Warehouse Storage Services

## RFP Title

Provision of Services for Office Relocation, Furniture Installation, Tenant Accommodation Support, and Warehouse Storage Services.

## Notice Information

* **Reference Number:** cb-6957-34236203
* **Amendment Number:** 2
* **Solicitation Number:** 30004388A
* **Publication Date:** 2023-07-05
* **Tender Closing Date:** 2023-07-20T13:00:00
* **Contract Start Date:** 2023-11-01
* **Contract End Date:** 2024-10-31
* **Procurement Category:** SRV
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open bidding

## Notice Description

Fisheries and Oceans Canada has a requirement for the provision of relocation services of office equipment and furniture, furniture installation, and general accommodation support, and possible warehouse storage services. The work will be requested by an email detailing the job requirements.

The services include:

* Installation and reconfiguration of panel systems
* Installation of white boards, picture frames, and other office fixtures
* Briefcase moves, regular moves, and office case good relocation
* Storage of previously purchased office furniture

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans and Canadian Coast Guard requires on-site additional resources for an “as-and-when is required” basis. This service must be provided directly and strictly to the department at specified locations.

The selected contractor will be responsible for:

* Maintaining an efficient level of accommodation services
* Ensuring a safe, accessible, and functional work environment

The scope of work includes the installation and reconfiguration of panel systems, and the installation of office fixtures.

## Tender Requirements

* The contractor must have experience in providing relocation and installation services.
* The contractor must demonstrate a understanding of the requirements of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans and Canadian Coast Guard.
* The contractor must have a proven track record of ensuring a safe, accessible, and functional work environment.

## Evaluation Criteria

The evaluation of the tenders will be based on the following criteria:

* Technical Merit
* Price

The tender that demonstrates the highest combined rating for Technical Merit and Price will be selected for award.

## Tender Documents

The tender documents can be found at the following website: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca](https://canadabuys.canada.ca)

Contact Information:

* Kar
